How to use DSITools

DSITools 0.3 offers a list of command line tools to interact with Zimory/DSI REST Server:

  • dsi-create-deployment: Creates a new Deployment with a previously uploaded Appliance to be run;
  • dsi-create-storage: Creates a Network Storage;
  • dsi-create-tags: Creates a Deployment snapshot;
  • dsi-describe-appliances: List and describe available Appliances;
  • dsi-describe-clouds: List and describe DSI Clouds;
  • dsi-describe-deployments: List and describe running Deployments
  • dsi-describe-networks: List and describe available Networks;
  • dsi-describe-storages: List and describe available Network Storages;
  • dsi-describe-users: List and describe users;
  • dsi-reboot-deployments: Reboot the specified Deployment(s);
  • dsi-start-deployments: Run the specified Deployment(s);
  • dsi-stop-deployments: Terminate the specified Deployment(s);
  • dsi-upload-appliance: Upload a VM image to be associated to an Appliance.

    The Windows version of that commands are named exactly the same, but with .bat extension.

Common parameters

By running whatever dsi- command with -h (or --help) option, it shows all the available options/flags can be turned on, there are some anyway shared between them:

    -X, --debug      Produce execution debug output.
                     Default: false
    -H, --host       The DSI web service URI.
                     Default: testcloud.t-systems.com
    -p, --password   The DSI account password.
    -u, --username   The DSI account username.
    -v, --version    Display version information.
                     Default: false

NOTE 1 with -u or --username it is intended the username part of the certificate (see Installation page).

NOTE 2 with -p or --password it is intended the the certificate password (see Installation page).
